itemListElement.name: Broccolini White Bean Frittata – Soy free Vegan Frittata. Glutenfree Recipe

@graph.name: Broccolini White Bean Frittata - Soy free Vegan Frittata. Glutenfree Recipe
@graph.description: Broccolini White Bean Frittata. Gluten free Soy free Nut-free Vegan Frittata with Chickpea flour, beans, veggies. Easy, wholesome breakfast.
recipeIngredient: 1 15 oz can great northern beans (or scant 1.5 cups cooked)
1.5 tsp dried thyme (use less if you are not a fan of thyme)
1/4 tsp each of garlic powder and onion powder
a very generous dash of black pepper
1/2 tsp each of chipotle pepper powder, mustard powder, garlic powder, oregano
1  loaded cup of chopped Broccolini/Broccoli (1/4 to 1/2 inch size chopped or use chopped greens)

recipeInstructions.text: Add all the ingredients under Bean feta in a bowl. Mix and mash the beans a bit.(mash atleast half the beans well) and let sit till you prep.
recipeInstructions.name: Add all the ingredients under Bean feta in a bowl. Mix and mash the beans a bit.(mash atleast half the beans well) and let sit till you prep.

recipeInstructions.text: Chop up the veggies and keep ready.
recipeInstructions.name: Chop up the veggies and keep ready.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix all the dry ingredients of the chickpea batter (all ingredients till baking powder). Whisk well to combine. Add the coconut milk, oil and water and mix to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix all the dry ingredients of the chickpea batter (all ingredients till baking powder). Whisk well to combine. Add the coconut milk, oil and water and mix to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chopped veggies, and white beans to the batter. fold in.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chopped veggies, and white beans to the batter. fold in.

recipeInstructions.text: Drop batter onto greased pie pan. Even it out. Top with tomato slices (optional).
recipeInstructions.name: Drop batter onto greased pie pan. Even it out. Top with tomato slices (optional).

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until the center is not jiggly and the edges lightly brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until the center is not jiggly and the edges lightly brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve warm with Sriracha/ketchup, with favorite gravy or dressings or in a sandwich.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve warm with Sriracha/ketchup, with favorite gravy or dressings or in a sandwich.
